task.title: Managing layouts in a drawing
task.shortdesc: You can rename layouts, delete layouts, and view a list of all layouts available in a drawing. You can also change the order in which the Layout tabs appear; the Model tab is always stationary.

context.p: If you want to rename, delete, or reorder a layout when the Layout tabs are hidden, you can type LAYOUT to make your changes or choose Screen Menu > Tabs to display the tabs.

step.cmd: Right-click the layout tab for the layout you want to rename and choose Rename from the shortcut menu.
In the Rename Layout dialog box, enter the new name for the layout.

result.p: The name can be up to 255 characters in length and can contain letters, numbers, the dollar sign ($), hyphen (-), and underscore (_), or any combination.

ol.li: Right-click the layout tab for the layout you want to deleteand click Delete on the shortcut menu.
In the warning box, click OK to delete the layout.
Any named views associated with the layout are deleted automatically when the layout is deleted.

result.p: NOTE You cannot delete the Model tab or the last remaining Layout tab. To delete all
geometry from the Model tab or a Layout tab, first select all geometry and then use the Erasecommand.
To view a list of all layouts

ol.li: Type LAYOUT and then press Enter.
On the command line, type? and then press Enter to list all layouts.
